intro: Draba candollei, commonly known as the Alpine mouse-ear cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. The plant has basal leaves that are kidney-shaped and hairy, with small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. Draba candollei is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
